Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. launched a solo shot against Flaherty in the top of the first
David Peralta mashed a two-run home run to extend the lead
Gavin Lux sacrifice fly to score Teoscar Hernandez
Jackson Merrill hit an RBI single to score Tatis to make it 4–1
In the eighth, Merrill hit a two-run home run to extend the lead, and Xander Bogaerts hit a solo shot to go back-to-back
Kyle Higashioka mashed a solo home run at the top of the ninth
Tatis slammed a two-run home run
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers’ record against the Padres at Petco Park is 1-4 in the 2024 regular season

Thanks to Padres play-by-play radio announcer Jesse Agler, 126 guys have played for the Dodgers and Padres in their careers. Yu Darvish was #111. But he is the only one to start a postseason game on the mound for both teams
Others: Max Muncy was the only Dodger to have a multi-hit game and had a home run on the night
The new Dodgers pitcher could not find his groove. Flaherty pitched 5 1/3 innings, allowing five hits, four earned runs, one walk and two strikeouts
Shohei Ohtani struck out twice and could not find his feet
As a unit, the Padres are one of the best-hitting teams in baseball. They showed off their strength from 1-through-9 in the lineup on Sunday
Darvish pitched seven innings, allowing three hits, one earned run, three strikeouts and two walks
Jake Cronenworth was the only Padres hitter not to record a hit. He went 0-for-4 with two strikeouts
